criterion: Reward for accurately documenting medication details discussed, including current levothyroxine dose of 88 mcg, morning empty-stomach timing, spacing from nighttime atorvastatin, and patient confirmation of adherence.
Reward for faithfully recording the patient's reported symptoms and impressions (no major changes, possibly more energetic, will monitor).
Penalize for omitting or distorting the clinician’s explicit advice to watch for palpitations or increased sweating as potential side-effects.
Penalize for introducing assessments, plans, diagnoses, medications, instructions, or other content not stated or implied in the transcript or supported by the chart.

Reward for selectively using pertinent chart information—hypothyroidism and hyperlipidemia diagnoses, current levothyroxine and atorvastatin prescriptions—while excluding chart data not relevant to the encounter.
Penalize for copying irrelevant chart elements (e.g., family history of heart attack, unused Canvas context categories) that were not referenced in the dialogue.
Reward for overall completeness and organized capture of all clinically relevant statements from the transcript with no significant omissions.
Penalize for any inaccuracies in concrete facts from the transcript or chart (medication names, dosages, timing, patient age/sex).
